transportAdvice: Amritsar's main attractions, including the Golden Temple, are clustered enough that walking between them is practical for most visitors; cycle rickshaws and auto-rickshaws are widely available and affordable for longer distances. Taxis can be hired locally for day trips, and the city is served by a modest local bus network, though most tourists rely on auto-rickshaws or pre-arranged vehicles.

weather.description: Cool and pleasant winter days with chilly nights; occasional fog can affect visibility and travel.
Mild and comfortable with slightly warmer days; a good month for sightseeing.
Warming up noticeably with clear skies; one of the more pleasant months to visit.
Hot and dry conditions set in; mornings are still manageable but afternoons can be intense.
Very hot and dry; outdoor sightseeing is best done early morning or late evening.
Extreme heat with the onset of pre-monsoon humidity; travel is challenging but possible.
Monsoon season brings frequent heavy rain and high humidity, offering some relief from peak heat.
Continued monsoon rains keep temperatures lower but conditions remain humid and wet.
Rains begin to ease but humidity remains high; temperatures are more bearable than peak summer.
Pleasant and sunny with cooling evenings; one of the best months to visit Amritsar.
Comfortably cool and clear; excellent conditions for exploring the Golden Temple and local markets.
Cool winter weather with cold nights; fog can occasionally develop, especially toward month's end.
